column9: nd. funeral services for phyllis will be held on wednesday

column15: daughter of harold and rose (meidl) alwin was born on december 11
column17: nd. she was reared on the family farm and attended lakota public school. she worked as a nurses aide at mercy hospital in devils lake. phyllis married richard lauckner on october 12
column18: 1963 at st. olaf church in devils lake. they moved to fargo for a short time and phyllis worked as a waitress in a local restaurant. they returned to devils lake and lived
column19: worked and raised their family here. she worked at lake region corporation for several years then began a long career in sales. for a number of years
column20: she worked in sales at kdlr/kvlr/kzzy and continued in sales at midcontinent cable tv for many years
column22: she returned to the alwin family homestead
column23: rural lakota and made it her home but due to increasing health concerns
column24: she moved to devils lake in 2014. phyllis loved the outdoors and beauty of nature; enjoying gardening
column26: taking photos and as an animal lover
column27: taking care of her kitties. in her younger years
column28: she spent many hours refinishing and refurbishing furniture. keeping up to date with family and her many friends meant daily phone calls to them all. phyllis leaves behind her beloved family. her children scott lauckner
column36: jesse and bo lauckner; brothers le. roy (coke) alwin
column42: nd; faithful companion snowball and several nieces and nephews. she was preceded in death by her parents; brothers marvin and delbert alwin and infant sister lois. print back express your condolences contact us get mobile version privacy terms of use 2004 - 2015 gilbertson funeral home funeral home website by batesville
